children.title: Is this inspection for a hospital?
children.hint: The report created will be for the Joint Commission layout.

children.title: Prior - Person at alarm-receiving facility notified before testing. (4.1.4)
Prior - Person at Fire Department notified before testing
Prior - Time FD notified before testing.
After - Person at alarm-receiving facility notified after testing.
After - Time alarm-receiving facility notified after testing.
After - Person at Fire Department notified after testing.
After - Time FD notified after testing.
After - Time AHJ notified after testing.
After - Date system restored to normal operation.
After - Time system restored to normal operation.
What equipment is part of Dry System?
children.hint: Select all devices associated with dry system.

children.title: Sprinkler heads free of leakage, corrosion, external loading, damage or loss of fluid in glass bulb element, painted heads, and pointed in proper direction.  (5.2.1.1.1; 5.2.1.1.2)
children.hint: 5.2.1.1.1  Any sprinkler that shows signs of any of the following shall be replaced  (1) Leakage (2) Corrosion detrimental to sprinkler performance  (3) Physical damage  (4) Loss of fluid in the glass bulb heat-responsive element  (5) Loading detrimental to sprinkler performance  (6) Paint other than that applied by the sprinkler manufacturer.   5.2.1.1.2 Any sprinkler that has been installed in the incorrect orientation shall be corrected by repositioning the branchline, drop, or sprig, or shall be replaced.

children.title: Escutcheons and coverplates in place, if applicable.  (5.2.1.1.5)
children.hint: 5.2.1.1.5  Escutcheons and coverplates for recessed, flush, and concealed sprinklers shall be replaced with their listed escutcheon or coverplate if found missing during the inspection.  5.2.1.1.5.1 Where the listed escutcheon or coverplate from a listed assembly is missing and is no longer commercially available, the sprinkler shall be replaced.

children.title: Minimum clearance maintained below all sprinklers  (5.2.1.2)
children.hint: 5.2.1.2  The minimum clearance to storage as described in 5.2.1.2.1 through 5.2.1.2.6 shall be maintained below all sprinkler deflectors.

children.title: Correct # of replacement sprinkler heads in head box to include all types and ratings installed.  (5.4.1.5 & 5.4.1.5.4)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.4  The stock of spare sprinklers shall include all types and ratings installed and shall be as follows  (1) For protected facilities having under 300 sprinklers — no fewer than 6 sprinklers   (2) For protected facilities having 300 to 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 12 sprinklers  (3) For protected facilities having over 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 24 sprinklers.

children.title: Sprinkler head wrench for each type head provided in head box (5.4.1.5.5)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.5 One sprinkler wrench as specified by the sprinkler manufacturer shall be provided in the cabinet for each type of sprinkler installed to be used for the removal and installation of sprinklers in the system.

children.title: List of sprinklers installed on the property posted on head box. (5.4.1.5.6)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.6 A list of the sprinklers installed in the property shall be posted in the sprinkler cabinet. 5.4.1.5.6.1 The list shall include the following (1) Sprinkler identification number (SIN) if equipped; or the manufacturer, model, orifice, deflector type, thermal sensitivity, and pressure rating (2) General description (3) Quantity of each type to be contained in the cabinet (4) Issue or revision date of the list.

children.title: System piping free of mechanical damage, leaks, corrosion, or external loads resting on or hung from pipe.  (5.2.2)
children.hint: 5.2.2.1  Pipe and fittings shall be free of mechanical damage, leakage, and corrosion. 5.2.2.2 Sprinkler piping shall not be subjected to external loads by materials either resting on the pipe or hung from the pipe

children.title: Pipe hangers, braces and supports are secure and undamaged.  (5.2.3)
children.hint: 5.2.3   Sprinkler pipe hangers, braces, and supports shall be inspected annually from the floor level.  5.2.3.1 Hangers, braces, and supports shall not be damaged, loose, or unattached.  5.2.3.2 Hangers, braces, and supports that are damaged, loose, or unattached shall be replaced or refastened.

children.title: Sprinklers installed for 50 years, have been replaced or sample tested.  (5.3.1.1.1)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1  Where sprinklers have been installed for 50 years, they shall be replaced or representative samples from one or more sample areas shall be tested.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Sprinklers with fast-response elements that have been installed for 20 years, have been replaced or sample taken.  (5.3.1.1.1.3)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1.3  Sprinklers manufactured using fast-response elements that have been installed for 20 years shall be replaced or representative samples shall be tested and then retested at 10-year intervals.  If no fast response element, then answer N/A.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Dry sprinklers that have been installed 15 years, have been replaced or sample taken.  (5.3.1.1.1.6)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1.6   Dry sprinklers that have been installed for 15 years shall be replaced or representative samples shall be tested and then retested at 10-year intervals.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Air and water pressure gauges operating properly (13.2.5.1.1)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.1  Gauges shall be inspected monthly to verify that the gauges are operable and not physically damaged.

children.title: Exterior of valve free of physical damage, trim valves in normal position and intermediate chamber not leaking  (13.4.5.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.2  The dry pipe valve shall be externally inspected monthly to verify the fllowing  (1)  The valve is free of physical damage.  (2) All trim valves are in the appropriate open or closed position.  (3) The intermediate chamber is not leaking.

children.title: Hydraulic nameplate securely attached legible (5.2.5)
children.hint: 5.2.5  The hydraulic design information sign shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, attached securely to the sprinkler riser, and is legible.

children.title: Information sign securely attached and legible. (5.2.7)
children.hint: 5.2.7  Information Sign. The information sign required by 4.1.9 shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, securely attached, and legible.  4.1.9.1 A permanently marked metal or rigid plastic information sign shall be placed at the system control riser supplying an antifreeze loop, dry system, preaction system, or auxiliary system control valve.   4.1.9.2 Each sign shall be secured with a corrosion-resistant wire, chain, or other approved means and shall indicate at least the following information (1) Location of the area served by the system  (2) Location of auxiliary drains and low-point drains for dry pipe and preaction systems  (3) The presence and location of antifreeze or other auxiliary systems  (4) The presence and location(s) of heat tape.

children.title: If system has auxiliary drains, is sign in place indicating number and location of each drain.  (13.4.5.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.2  Systems with auxiliary drains shall require a sign at the dry valve indicating the number of auxiliary drains and the location of each individual drain.

children.title: Auxiliary drains and low-point drains opened, pipe drained or where weep holes  provided, inspected to ensure they are clear and unobstructed (13.4.5.3.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.3.2  Auxiliary drains in dry pipe sprinkler systems shall be drained after each operation of the system, before the onset of freezing weather conditions, and thereafter as needed.

children.title: Priming water level correct (13.4.5.2.1)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.1  The priming water level shall be tested quarterly.

children.title: Pressure (psi) shown on air side pressure gauge.
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3 Gauges monitoring air or nitrogen pressure shall be inspected monthly to verify that normal air or nitrogen pressure are being maintained.  Table 5.5.2(d)  Gauges on Air side, dry pipe system.

children.title: Partial trip test of the dry pipe valve conducted with control valve partially opened.   (13.4.5.2.2.3)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.2.3  During those years when full flow testing in accordance with 13.4.5.2.2.2 is not required, each dry pipe valve shall be trip tested with the control valve partially open.

children.title: Air pressure (psi) at trip of dry valve.  (A.13.4.5.2.2.3)
children.hint: A.13.4.5.2.2.3   (4) Record the system air or nitrogen pressure and the supply water pressure.

children.title: Time (sec) between start of test and trip of valve. (13.4.5.2.5.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.5.2  Records of dry pipe valve tripping time and water transit delivery time to the inspector’s test connection shall be maintained for full flow trip tests.

children.title: Full flow trip test of dry valve conducted with control valve opened fully.  (13.4.5.2.2.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.2.2  Every 3 years and whenever the system is altered, the dry pipe valve shall be trip tested with the control valve fully open and the quick-opening device, if provided, in service.

children.title: Time (sec) between start of test and water flow from inspectors test connection.  (13.4.5.2.5.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.5.2  Records of dry pipe valve tripping time and water transit delivery time to the inspector’s test connection shall be maintained for full flow trip tests.

children.title: Internal inspection - components operate properly and move freely, valve cleaned and in good condition. (13.4.5.3)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.3 The interior of the dry pipe valve shall be inspected annually when the trip test is conducted.  13.4.5.3.1 During the annual trip test, the interior of the dry pipe valve shall be cleaned thoroughly, and parts replaced or repaired as necessary.

children.title: System testing for gas leakage (13.4.5.2.9)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.9  Dry pipe systems shall be tested once every 3 years for gas leakage

children.title: Valve strainers, filters, and restriction orifices free from obstructions, operating properly, and in good condition (13.4.5.1.4)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.4  Strainers, filters, and restricted orifices shall be inspected internally every 5 years unless tests indicate a greater frequency is necessary. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Gauges on valve, when compared to calibrated gauge error less than 3% full scale or gauge has been recalibrated or replaced.  (13.2.52)
children.hint: 13.2.5.2  Gauges shall be replaced every 5 years or tested every 5 years by comparison with a calibrated gauge.  13.2.5.3  Gauges not accurate to within 3 percent of the full scale shall be recalibrated or replaced. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Valve Status Test - Valves open when returned to service.  (13.3.3.4)
children.hint: 13.3.3.4  A valve status test shall be conducted any time the control valve is closed and reopened at system riser

children.title: Dry sprinkler system auxiliary drain(s) drained as needed during this inspection.  (13.4.5.3.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.3.2  Auxiliary drains in dry pipe sprinkler systems shall be drained after each operation of the system, before the onset of freezing weather conditions, and thereafter as needed.

children.title: Compressor free of physical damage, wiring and piping intact and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following  (1)  Air compressor or nitrogen generator is free of physical damage.  (2) Power wiring to the air compressor is intact and free of physical damage.  (3) Piping from the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the fire protection system is intact and free of physical damage.

children.title: Compressors requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Anchoring of air compressor is secure, tight and without damage.  (13.10.2.1)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (4) The means of anchoring the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the structure or to the system piping is secure, tight, and free of physical damage.

children.title: Air compressor operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.  (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.title: Automatic air maintenance device pressure maintained at proper setting for system (13.4.5.2.8)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.8  Automatic air pressure maintenance devices, if provided, shall be tested annually during the dry pipe valve trip test in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue

children.title: Nitrogen Generator free of physical damage, wiring and piping intact and without damage. (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following  (1)  Air compressor or nitrogen generator is free of physical damage.  (2) Power wiring to the air compressor is intact and free of physical damage.  (3) Piping from the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the fire protection system is intact and free of physical damage.

children.title: Anchoring of nitrogen generator is secure, tight and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (4) The means of anchoring the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the structure or to the system piping is secure, tight, and free of physical damage.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.   (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.title: Exterior in good condition, free from leakage and gauge operable (13.4.5.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.2  The dry pipe valve shall be externally inspected monthly to verify the following (1) The valve is free of physical damage. (2) All trim valves are in the appropriate open or closed position. (3) The intermediate chamber is not leaking.

children.title: Pressure (psi) shown on gauge.
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3.1  The gauge on the quick-opening device, if provided, shall indicate the same pressure as the gauge on the system side of the dry pipe valve.

children.title: Gauge indicating same pressure as air gauge on valve.  (13.2.5.1.3.1)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3.1  The gauge on the quick-opening device, if provided, shall indicate the same pressure as the gauge on the system side of the dry pipe valve.

children.title: QOD tested and working properly.  (13.4.5.2.4)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.4  Quick-opening devices, if provided, shall be tested quarterly.  (A.13.4.5.2.2.3  (8) Trip test the quick-opening device, if installed, in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions)

children.title: Internal inspection - all components operate properly, move freely and in good condition (13.4.5.1.3)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.3  The interior of the dry pipe valve shall be inspected annually when the trip test is conducted.

children.title: Escutcheons and coverplates in place, if applicable.  (5.2.1.1.5)
children.hint: 5.2.1.1.5 Escutcheons and coverplates for recessed, flush, and concealed sprinklers shall be replaced with their listed escutcheon or coverplate if found missing during the inspection.  5.2.1.1.5.1 Where the listed escutcheon or coverplate from a listed assembly is missing and is no longer commercially available, the sprinkler shall be replaced.

children.title: Minimum clearance maintained below all sprinklers.  (5.2.1.2)
children.hint: 5.2.1.2 The minimum clearance to storage as described in 5.2.1.2.1 through 5.2.1.2.6 shall be maintained below all sprinkler deflectors.

children.title: Replacement sprinkler heads per number of installed sprinklers available in head box.  (5.4.1.5.4)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.4 The stock of spare sprinklers shall include all types and ratings installed and shall be as follows:  (1) For protected facilities having under 300 sprinklers — no fewer than 6 sprinklers   (2) For protected facilities having 300 to 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 12 sprinklers  (3) For protected facilities having over 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 24 sprinklers

children.title: Sprinkler head wrench for each type head provided in head box.  (5.4.1.5.5)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.5 One sprinkler wrench as specified by the sprinkler manufacturer shall be provided in the cabinet for each type of sprinkler installed to be used for the removal and installation of sprinklers in the system.

children.title: List of sprinklers installed on the property posted on head box.  (5.4.1.5.6)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.6  A list of the sprinklers installed in the property shall be posted in the sprinkler cabinet.  5.4.1.5.6.1 The list shall include the following:  (1) Sprinkler identification number (SIN) if equipped; or the manufacturer, model, orifice, deflector type, thermal sensitivity, and pressure rating  (2) General description  (3) Quantity of each type to be contained in the cabinet  (4) Issue or revision date of the list.

children.title: System piping free of mechanical damage, leaks, corrosion, & without external loads on or hung from piping.  (5.2.2.1 & 5.2.2.2)
children.hint: 5.2.2.1 Pipe and fittings shall be free of mechanical damage, leakage, and corrosion.   5.2.2.2 Sprinkler piping shall not be subjected to external loads by materials either resting on the pipe or hung from the pipe.

children.title: Pipe hangars, braces & supports not damaged, loose or unattached.  (5.2.3)
children.hint: 5.2.3  Sprinkler pipe hangers, braces, and supports shall be inspected annually from the floor level. 5.2.3.1 Hangers, braces, and supports shall not be damaged, loose, or unattached. 5.2.3.2 Hangers, braces, and supports that are damaged, loose, or unattached shall be replaced or refastened.

children.title: Sprinklers installed for 50 years, have been replaced or sample tested.  (5.3.1.1.1)

Water pressure gauge indicate normal pressure being maintained. (13.4.1.1))
children.hint: 13.4.1.1  Alarm valves and system riser check valves shall be externally inspected quarterly and shall verify the following: (1) The gauges indicate normal supply water pressure is being maintained.

children.title: Valves & trim free of physical damage, & valves in normal position. (13.4.1.1)
children.hint: 13.4.1.1  Alarm valves and system riser check valves shall be externally inspected quarterly and shall verify the following: (2) The valves and trim are free of physical damage.  (3) All valves are in the appropriate open or closed position.

children.title: Valve is accessible and free of external leaks & properly secured  (13.3.2.2)
children.hint: 13.3.2.2 The valve inspection shall verify that the valves are in the following condition: (2) Sealed, locked, or supervised  (3) Accessible (5) Free from external leaks

children.title: Retard chamber and alarm drains free from leakage. (13.4.1.1)
children.hint: 13.4.1.1 Alarm valves and system riser check valves shall be externally inspected quarterly and shall verify the following: (4) The retarding chamber or alarm drains are not leaking.

children.title: Hydraulic nameplate, if applicable, securely attached and is legible (5.2.5)
children.hint: 5.2.5 Hydraulic Design Information Sign. The hydraulic design information sign shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, attached securely to the sprinkler riser, and is legible.

children.title: Pressure (psi) shown on System side pressure gauge.
Valve Status Test - Valves open when returned to service.  (13.3.3.4)
children.hint: 13.3.3.4 A valve status test shall be conducted any time the control valve is closed and reopened at system riser.

children.title: Internally inspect all components operate properly and move freely, valve cleaned and in good condition. (13.4.2.1)
children.hint: 13.4.2.1 Inspection. Valves shall be inspected internally every 5 years to verify that all of the valve’s components operate correctly. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Internally inspect valve strainers, filters, and restriction orifices; free from obstructions, & operating properly. (13.4.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.1.2  Alarm valves and their associated strainers, filters, and restriction orifices shall be inspected internally every 5 years unless tests indicate a greater frequency is necessary. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.hint: 13.2.7.2  Gauges shall be replaced every 5 years or tested every 5 years by comparison with a calibrated gauge.   13.2.7.3 Gauges not accurate to within 3 percent of the full scale shall be recalibrated or replaced. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.hint: 5.2.1.2  The minimum clearance to storage as described in 5.2.1.2.1 through 5.2.1.2.6 shall be maintained below all sprinkler deflectors.

children.title: Replacement sprinkler heads per number of installed sprinklers available in head box.  (5.4.1.5.4)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.4  The stock of spare sprinklers shall include all types and ratings installed and shall be as follows  (1) For protected facilities having under 300 sprinklers — no fewer than 6 sprinklers   (2) For protected facilities having 300 to 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 12 sprinklers  (3) For protected facilities having over 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 24 sprinklers.

children.title: Sprinkler head wrench for each type head provided in head box (5.4.1.5.5)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.5 One sprinkler wrench as specified by the sprinkler manufacturer shall be provided in the cabinet for each type of sprinkler installed to be used for the removal and installation of sprinklers in the system.

children.title: List of sprinklers installed on the property posted on head box.  (5.4.1.5.6)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.6  A list of the sprinklers installed in the property shall be posted in the sprinkler cabinet.  5.4.1.5.6.1 The list shall include the following  (1) Sprinkler identification number (SIN) if equipped; or the manufacturer, model, orifice, deflector type, thermal sensitivity, and pressure rating  (2) General description  (3) Quantity of each type to be contained in the cabinet  (4) Issue or revision date of the list

children.title: System piping free of mechanical damage, leaks, corrosion, & without external loads on or hung from piping.  (5.2.2.1 & 5.2.2.2)
children.hint: 5.2.2.1 Pipe and fittings shall be free of mechanical damage, leakage, and corrosion.  5.2.2.2 Sprinkler piping shall not be subjected to external loads by materials either resting on the pipe or hung from the pipe.

children.title: Pipe hangars, braces & supports not damaged, loose or unattached.  (5.2.3)
children.hint: 5.2.3 Sprinkler pipe hangers, braces, and supports shall be inspected annually from the floor level. 5.2.3.1 Hangers, braces, and supports shall not be damaged, loose, or unattached. 5.2.3.2 Hangers, braces, and supports that are damaged, loose, or unattached shall be replaced or refastened.

children.title: Sprinklers installed for 50 years, have been replaced or sample tested.  (5.3.1.1.1)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1  Where sprinklers have been installed for 50 years, they shall be replaced or representative samples from one or more sample areas shall be tested.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Sprinklers with fast-response elements installed for 20 years have been replaced or sample tested.  (5.3.1.1.1.3)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1.3  Sprinklers manufactured using fast-response elements that have been installed for 20 years shall be replaced or representative samples shall be tested and then retested at 10-year intervals.  If no fast response element, then answer N/A.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Dry sprinklers that have been installed 15 years, have been replaced or sample taken.  (5.3.1.1.1.6)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1.6   Dry sprinklers that have been installed for 15 years shall be replaced or representative samples shall be tested and then retested at 10-year intervals.

children.title: Date
children.hint: Enter month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Air and water pressure gauges operating properly (13.2.5.1.1)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.1  Gauges shall be inspected monthly to verify that the gauges are operable and not physically damaged.

children.title: Exterior of valve not damaged, trim valves in normal position, valve seat not leaking, electrical parts in service (13.4.3.1.1)
children.hint: 13.4.3.1.1  The preaction valve shall be externally inspected monthly to verify the following  (1) The valve is free from physical damage  (2) All trim valves are in the appropriate open or closed position.  (3) The valve seat is not leaking.  (4) Electrical components are in service.

children.title: Hydraulic nameplate, if applicable, securely attached and legible (5.2.5)
children.hint: 5.2.5  Hydraulic Design Information Sign. The hydraulic design information sign shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, attached securely to the sprinkler riser, and is legible.

children.title: Information sign securely attached and legible. (5.2.7)
children.hint: 5.2.7  Information Sign. The information sign required by 4.1.9 shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, securely attached, and legible.  4.1.9.1 A permanently marked metal or rigid plastic information sign shall be placed at the system control riser supplying an antifreeze loop, dry system, preaction system, or auxiliary system control valve.   4.1.9.2 Each sign shall be secured with a corrosion-resistant wire, chain, or other approved means and shall indicate at least the following information (1) Location of the area served by the system  (2) Location of auxiliary drains and low-point drains for dry pipe and preaction systems  (3) The presence and location of antifreeze or other auxiliary systems  (4) The presence and location(s) of heat tape.

children.title: The priming water level is acceptable. (13.4.3.2.1  )
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.1  The priming water level in supervised preaction systems shall be tested quarterly for compliance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

children.title: Pressure (psi) shown on System side pressure gauge.  (13.2.5.1.3.2)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3.2  Where air pressure supervision is connected to a constantly attended location, gauges shall be inspected quarterly.

children.title: Internal inspection -  all components operate properly and move freely, valve cleaned with no internal damage.  (13.4.3.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.3.1.2  The interior of the preaction valve and the condition of detection devices shall be inspected annually when the trip test is conducted.

children.title: Trip test conducted with control valve partially opened (13.4.3.2.3)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.3 During those years when full flow testing in accordance with 13.4.3.2.2 is not required, the preaction valve shall be trip tested with the control valve partially open.

children.title: System activated using the manual actuation devices (13.4.3.2.7)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.7  Manual Operation. Manual actuation devices shall be operated annually.

children.title: Auxiliary drains operated after each system operation.  (13.4.3.3.3)
children.hint: 13.4.3.3.3  Auxiliary drains in preaction systems shall be operated after each system operation and before the onset of freezing conditions (and thereafter as needed).

children.title: Full flow trip test conducted with control valve open (13.4.3.2.2)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.2  Except for preaction systems covered by 13.4.3.2.4, every 3 years the preaction valve shall be trip tested with the control valve fully open.

children.title: Time (sec) between start of test and trip of valve. (13.4.3.2.10 )
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.10  Records indicating the date the preaction valve was last tripped and the tripping time, as well as the individual and organization conducting the test, shall be maintained at a location or in a manner readily available for review by the authority having jurisdiction.

children.title: Maintenance performed on system after trip test to ensure properly returned to service.  (13.4.3.2.8)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.8  After the annual trip test, the preaction system shall be returned to service in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

children.title: Valve Status Test - Valves open when returned to service.  (13.3.3.4)
children.hint: 13.3.3.4  A valve status test shall be conducted any time the control valve is closed and reopened at system riser.

children.title: System testing for air leakage  (13.4.3.2.6)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.6  Preaction systems shall be tested once every 3 years for air leakage, using one of the following test methods  (1) Perform a pressure test at 40 psi (3.2 bar) for 2 hours.  The system shall be permitted to lose up to 3 psi (0.2 bar) during the duration of the test. Air leaks shall be addressed if the system loses more than 3 psi (0.2 bar) during this test.  (2) With the system at normal system pressure, shut off the air source (compressor or shop air) for 4 hours. If the low air pressure alarm goes off within this period, the air leaks shall be addressed.

children.title: Internally inspect strainers, filters, restricted orifices and diaphragm chambers to ensure they are free from obstructions or damage.  (13.4.3.1.3)
children.hint: 13.4.3.1.3  Strainers, filters, restricted orifices, and diaphragm chambers shall be inspected internally every 5 years unless tests indicate a greater frequency is necessary. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Gauges on valve, when compared to calibrated gauge, error is less than 3% full scale or gauge has been recalibrated or replaced.  (13.2.5.2 & 13.2.5.3)
children.hint: 13.2.5.2  Gauges shall be replaced every 5 years or tested every 5 years by comparison with a calibrated gauge.  13.2.5.3  Gauges not accurate to within 3 percent of the full scale shall be recalibrated or replaced. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Sprinkler system auxiliary drain(s) drained as needed during this inspection (13.4.4.3.3)
children.hint: 13.4.3.3.3  Auxiliary drains in preaction systems shall be operated after each system operation and before the onset of freezing conditions (and thereafter as needed).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Compressor free of physical damage, wiring and piping intact and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following  (1)  Air compressor or nitrogen generator is free of physical damage.  (2) Power wiring to the air compressor is intact and free of physical damage.  (3) Piping from the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the fire protection system is intact and free of physical damage.

children.title: Compressors requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.4.4.2.15)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Anchoring of air compressor is secure, tight and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (4) The means of anchoring the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the structure or to the system piping is secure, tight, and free of physical damage.

children.title: Air compressor operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.  (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Automatic air maintenance device pressure maintained at proper setting for system.  (13.4.3.2.13)
children.hint: 13.4.3.2.13   Automatic air pressure maintenance devices, if provided, shall be tested yearly at the time of the annual preaction valve trip test, in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Detectors in place, securely fastened, & protected from mechanical damage & corrosion  (13.9.2)
children.hint: 13.9.2 Automatic detection equipment used to actuate water-based fire protection systems that is not covered by NFPA 72 shall be inspected, tested, and maintained to ensure that the communication wiring, control panels, or pneumatic tubing system is functional.

children.title: Communication wiring, control units, or tubing system is functional.  (13.9.2)
children.hint: 13.9.2 Automatic detection equipment used to actuate water-based fire protection systems that is not covered by NFPA 72 shall be inspected, tested, and maintained to ensure that the communication wiring, control panels, or pneumatic tubing system is functional.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Nitrogen Generator free of physical damage, wiring and piping intact and without damage. (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following  (1)  Air compressor or nitrogen generator is free of physical damage.  (2) Power wiring to the air compressor is intact and free of physical damage.  (3) Piping from the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the fire protection system is intact and free of physical damage.

children.title: Anchoring of nitrogen generator is secure, tight and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (4) The means of anchoring the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the structure or to the system piping is secure, tight, and free of physical damage.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.   (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Exterior in good condition, free from leakage and gauge operable (13.4.5.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.5.1.2  The dry pipe valve shall be externally inspected monthly to verify the following (1) The valve is free of physical damage. (2) All trim valves are in the appropriate open or closed position. (3) The intermediate chamber is not leaking.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Pressure (psi) shown on gauge.
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3.1  The gauge on the quick-opening device, if provided, shall indicate the same pressure as the gauge on the system side of the dry pipe valve.

children.title: Gauge indicating same pressure as air gauge on valve.  (13.2.5.1.3.1)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.3.1  The gauge on the quick-opening device, if provided, shall indicate the same pressure as the gauge on the system side of the dry pipe valve.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
QOD tested and working properly.  (13.4.5.2.4)
children.hint: 13.4.5.2.4  Quick-opening devices, if provided, shall be tested quarterly.  (A.13.4.5.2.2.3  (8) Trip test the quick-opening device, if installed, in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions)

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Internal inspection - all components operate properly, move freely and in good condition (13.4.5.1.3)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.5 One sprinkler wrench as specified by the sprinkler manufacturer shall be provided in the cabinet for each type of sprinkler installed to be used for the removal and installation of sprinklers in the system.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
What equipment is part of deluge system?
Sprinkler system auxiliary drain(s) drained as needed during this inspection.
children.hint: 13.4.4.3.3  Auxiliary drains in deluge systems shall be operated after each system operation and before the onset of freezing conditions (and thereafter as needed).

children.title: Sprinkler heads free of leakage, corrosion, external loading, damage or loss of fluid in glass bulb element, painted heads, and pointed in proper direction.  (5.2.1.1.1 )
children.hint: 5.2.1.1.1  Any sprinkler that shows signs of any of the following shall be replaced  (1) Leakage (2) Corrosion detrimental to sprinkler performance  (3) Physical damage  (4) Loss of fluid in the glass bulb heat-responsive element  (5) Loading detrimental to sprinkler performance  (6) Paint other than that applied by the sprinkler manufacturer.   5.2.1.1.2 Any sprinkler that has been installed in the incorrect orientation shall be corrected by repositioning the branchline, drop, or sprig, or shall be replaced.

children.title: Minimum clearance maintained below all sprinklers.  (5.2.1.2 )
children.hint: 5.2.1.2  The minimum clearance to storage as described in 5.2.1.2.1 through 5.2.1.2.6 shall be maintained below all sprinkler deflectors.

children.title: Escutcheons and coverplates in place, if applicable.  (5.2.1.1.5 )
children.hint: 5.2.1.1.5  Escutcheons and coverplates for recessed, flush, and concealed sprinklers shall be replaced with their listed escutcheon or coverplate if found missing during the inspection.  5.2.1.1.5.1 Where the listed escutcheon or coverplate from a listed assembly is missing and is no longer commercially available, the sprinkler shall be replaced.

children.title: Replacement sprinkler heads per number of installed sprinklers available in head box.  (5.4.1.5 & 5.4.1.5.4)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5  A supply of at least six spare sprinklers shall be maintained on the premises so that any sprinklers that have operated or been damaged in any way can be promptly replaced.   5.4.1.5.4 The stock of spare sprinklers shall include all types and ratings installed and shall be as follows  (1) For protected facilities having under 300 sprinklers — no fewer than 6 sprinklers   (2) For protected facilities having 300 to 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 12 sprinklers  (3) For protected facilities having over 1000 sprinklers — no fewer than 24 sprinklers

children.title: Sprinkler head wrench for each type head provided in head box (5.4.1.5.5)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.5  One sprinkler wrench as specified by the sprinkler manufacturer shall be provided in the cabinet for each type of sprinkler installed to be used for the removal and installation of sprinklers in the system.

children.title: List of sprinklers installed on the property posted on head box.  (5.4.1.5.6)
children.hint: 5.4.1.5.6  A list of the sprinklers installed in the property shall be posted in the sprinkler cabinet.  5.4.1.5.6.1 The list shall include the following  (1) Sprinkler identification number (SIN) if equipped; or the manufacturer, model, orifice, deflector type, thermal sensitivity, and pressure rating  (2) General description  (3) Quantity of each type to be contained in the cabinet  (4) Issue or revision date of the list

children.title: System piping free of mechanical damage, leaks, corrosion, & without external loads on or hung from piping.  (5.2.2.1 & 5.2.2.2)
children.hint: 5.2.2.1  Pipe and fittings shall be free of mechanical damage, leakage, and corrosion.  5.2.2.2 Sprinkler piping shall not be subjected to external loads by materials either resting on the pipe or hung from the pipe.

children.title: Pipe hangars, braces & supports not damaged, loose or unattached.  (5.2.3)
children.hint: 5.2.3  Sprinkler pipe hangers, braces, and supports shall be inspected annually from the floor level. 5.2.3.1 Hangers, braces, and supports shall not be damaged, loose, or unattached. 5.2.3.2 Hangers, braces, and supports that are damaged, loose, or unattached shall be replaced or refastened.

children.title: Sprinklers installed for 50 years, have been replaced or sample tested.  (5.3.1.1.1)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1  Where sprinklers have been installed for 50 years, they shall be replaced or representative samples from one or more sample areas shall be tested.

children.title: Date
children.hint: month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: Sprinklers with fast-response elements that have been installed for 20 years, have been replaced or sample taken.  (5.3.1.1.1.3)
children.hint: 5.3.1.1.1.3  Sprinklers manufactured using fast-response elements that have been installed for 20 years shall be replaced or representative samples shall be tested and then retested at 10-year intervals.  If no fast response element, then answer N/A.

children.title: Date
children.hint: month/year sprinklers replaced or tested.

children.title: If system is pilot actuated, are pilot heads free from foreign material, damage or paint?
children.hint: Indicate pilot head conditions.

children.title: Exterior free of physical damage, all trim valves in normal position, valve seat not leaking and any electrical parts are in service.  (13.4.4.1.1)
children.hint: 13.4.4.1.1  The Deluge valve shall be externally inspected monthly to verify the following:  (1) The valve is free from physical damage  (2) All trim valves are in the appropriate open or closed position.  (3) The valve seat is not leaking.  (4) Electrical components are in service

children.title: Hydraulic nameplate securely attached legible (5.2.5)
children.hint: 5.2.5  The hydraulic design information sign shall be inspected annually to verify that it is provided, attached securely to the sprinkler riser, and is legible.

children.title: Water pressure gauge operating properly.  (13.2.5.1.2)
children.hint: 13.2.5.1.2  Gauges monitoring water pressure shall be inspected quarterly to verify that normal water supply pressure is being maintained.

children.title: Trip test conducted with deluge valve fully opened.  (13.4.4.2.3)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.3  Except as provided by 13.4.4.2.3.1 and 13.4.4.2.3.2, each deluge valve shall be trip tested annually at full flow in warm weather and in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.  13.4.4.2.3.1 Where the nature of the protected property is such that water cannot be discharged for test purposes, an annual trip test shall be permitted to be conducted in a manner that does not necessitate discharge in the protected area.   	13.4.4.2.5 Full flow deluge valve tests, in accordance with 13.4.4.2.3 and 13.4.4.2.3.2, shall be conducted with the deluge system control valve fully open.

children.title: Under test conditions, detection system operated. (13.9.2)
children.hint: 13.9.2  Automatic detection equipment used to actuate water-based fire protection systems that is not covered by NFPA 72 shall be inspected, tested, and maintained to ensure that the communication wiring, control panels, or pneumatic tubing system is functional.

children.title: Time lapse (sec) between operation of detection system and water delivery to protected area. (13.4.4.2.12)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.12  Records indicating the date the deluge valve was last tripped and the tripping time, as well as the individual and organization conducting the test, shall be maintained at a location or in a manner readily available for review by the authority having jurisdiction.

children.title: Pressure (psi) at hydraulically most remote nozzle during test. (13.4.4.2.7.1)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.7.2   A second pressure reading shall be recorded at the deluge valve

children.title: Full flow test pressure readings from hydraulically most remote nozzle and valve compare favorably to original system requirements.  (13.4.4.2.7.3)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.7.3 These readings shall be compared to the hydraulic design pressures to ensure the original system design requirements are met by the water supply.

children.title: Pressure (psi) at the deluge valve during test. (13.4.4.2.7.2)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.7.2   A second pressure reading shall be recorded at the deluge valve.

children.title: System activated using the manual actuation devices. (13.4.4.2.9)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.9 Manual Operation. Manual actuation devices shall be operated annually.

children.title: Detection devices in working condition, and interior of valve clean and in good condition. (13.4.4.1.2)
children.hint: 13.4.4.1.2  The interior of the deluge valve and the condition of detection devices shall be inspected annually when the trip test is conducted.

children.title: Water spray discharge from nozzles flowing freely, positioned properly, and not obstructed.  (13.4.4.2.4)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.4  During the annual full flow test, the water discharge patterns from all of the open spray nozzles or sprinklers shall be observed to ensure that patterns are not impeded by plugged nozzles, that nozzles are correctly positioned, and that obstructions do not prevent discharge patterns from wetting surfaces to be protected

children.title: Auxiliary drains operated and tested for leaks (13.4.4.3.3)
children.hint: 13.4.4.3.3  Auxiliary drains in deluge systems shall be operated after each system operation and before the onset of freezing conditions (and thereafter as needed).

children.title: Internal inspection - all components operate properly and move freely, and valve cleaned and in good condition.  (13.4.4.1.4)
children.hint: 13.4.4.1.2 The interior of the deluge valve and the condition of detection devices shall be inspected annually when the trip test is conducted.

children.title: Strainers, filters, restricted orifice,diaphragm chambers inspected for damage and cleaned.
children.hint: 13.4.4.1.3 Strainers, filters, restricted orifices, and diaphragm chambers shall be inspected internally every 5 years unless tests indicate a greater frequency is necessary. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: Gauges on valve, when compared to calibrated gauge error less than 3% full scale or gauge has been recalibrated or replaced.  (13.2.5.2 & 13.2.5.3)
children.hint: 13.2.5.2  Gauges shall be replaced every 5 years or tested every 5 years by comparison with a calibrated gauge.  13.2.5.3  Gauges not accurate to within 3 percent of the full scale shall be recalibrated or replaced. FREQUENCY SET TO ANNUAL TO ALLOW A GREATER FREQUENCY IF NECESSARY. NFPA REQUIREMENT IS STILL 5YR.

children.title: System returned to service according to manufacturer's instructions.  (13.4.4.2.10)
children.hint: 13.4.4.2.10 Return to Service. After the annual trip test, the system shall be returned to service in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

children.title: Air Compressor requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Air compressor operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.   (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.hint: 13.9.2 Automatic detection equipment used to actuate waterbased fire protection systems that is not covered by NFPA 72 shall be inspected, tested, and maintained to ensure that the detectors are in place, securely fastened, and protected from corrosion, weather, and mechanical damage.

children.title: Communication wiring, control units, or tubing system is functional.
children.hint: 13.9.2 Automatic detection equipment used to actuate waterbased fire protection systems that is not covered by NFPA 72 shall be inspected, tested, and maintained to ensure that the communication wiring, control panels, or pneumatic tubing system is functional.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator free of physical damage, wiring and piping intact and without damage. (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following  (1)  Air compressor or nitrogen generator is free of physical damage.  (2) Power wiring to the air compressor is intact and free of physical damage.  (3) Piping from the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the fire protection system is intact and free of physical damage.

children.title: Anchoring of nitrogen generator is secure, tight and without damage.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (4) The means of anchoring the air compressor or nitrogen generator to the structure or to the system piping is secure, tight, and free of physical damage.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator requiring oil, ensure correct amount is in oil reservoir.  (13.10.2)
children.hint: 13.10.2  Air compressors and nitrogen generators dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected monthly to verify the following   (5) Air compressors requiring oil have the required amount of oil in the oil reservoir.

children.title: Nitrogen Generator operates as intended, restores normal air pressure within required time, and does not overheat while running.   (13.10.3)
children.hint: 13.10.3 Testing.  Air compressors or nitrogen generator dedicated to water-based fire protection systems shall be tested annually to verify the following  (1) Air compressor or nitrogen generator operates as intended on the proper drop of air pressure in the fire protection system.  (2) Air compressor or nitrogen generator restores normal supervisory pressure in the fire protection system in the required time frame.  (3) Air compressor does not overheat while running.

children.hint: List of Deficiencies for Deluge nitrogen generator

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Information sign securely attached and legible.
children.hint: 4.1.10 Antifreeze Information Sign. An antifreeze information sign shall be placed on the antifreeze system main valve, which indicates the manufacture type and brand of the antifreeze solution, the concentration by volume of the antifreeze solution used, and the volume of the antifreeze solution used in the system.  5.2.9  The antifreeze information sign required by 4.1.10 shall be inspected annually to verify that it is present, securely attached and legible.

children.title: List type of solution in antifreeze system.
children.hint: 5.3.4  Annually, before the onset of freezing weather, the antifreeze solution shall be tested using following procedure; Using the antifreeze information sign required by 4.1.10, installation records, maintenance records, information from the owner, chemical tests, or other reliable sources of information, the type of antifreeze in the system shall be determined.

children.title: Antifreeze specific gravity as measured meet solution requirements.
children.hint: 5.3.4(3)  The specific gravity of each solution shall be checked using a hydrometer with a suitable scale or a refractometer having a scale calibrated for the antifreeze solution.

children.title: Antifreeze tested and results indicate correct freeze points in system.
children.hint: 5.3.4.2.1  If the results indicate an incorrect freeze point at any point in the system, the system shall be drained and refilled with new premixed antifreeze.
